title: HTML Images
gp1: Images can improve the design and the appearance of a web page.
gp2: Images are not technically inserted into a web page; images are linked to web pages. The tag creates a holding space for the referenced image.
gp3: The tag is empty, it contains attributes only, and does not have a closing tag.
gp4: Note: When a web page loads, it is the browser, at that moment, that gets the image from a web server and inserts it into the page. Therefore, make sure that the image actually stays in the same spot in relation to the web page, otherwise your visitors will get a broken link icon. The broken link icon and the alt text are shown if the browser cannot find the image.
gp5: The required alt attribute provides an alternate text for an image, if the user for some reason cannot view it (because of slow connection, an error in the src attribute, or if the user uses a screen reader).
gp6: If a browser cannot find an image, it will display the value of the alt attribute:
